title: Love Lies Bleeding
overview: Reclusive gym manager Lou falls hard for Jackie, an ambitious bodybuilder headed through town to Las Vegas in pursuit of her dream. But their love ignites violence, pulling them deep into the web of Lou’s criminal family.
production_countries: United Kingdom, United States of America
snippet: In this neo-noir, the ever reliable, always watchable actress plays a small-town loner who’s struck by the unexpected arrival of a mysterious drifter.

title: Bleeding Love
overview: In an effort to reunite with his daughter after a period of absence, a father takes her on a road trip to Santa Fe, New Mexico. Along the way they encounter some interesting characters and obstacles while sorting out their relationship.
snippet: Ewan McGregor plays father to his real-life daughter Clara McGregor in this indie road-trip movie that’s also a meandering journey to healing.

title: Fallen Leaves
overview: This anthology film comprises seven segments crafted by seven distinct Hong Kong-based filmmakers collaborating to offer a contemporary interpretation and tribute to the multifaceted aspects and diverse characters within this international city. Through numerous vignettes, the film embarks on an introspective journey, presenting unexpected narratives with unique flavors that showcase the mosaic of Hong Kong's vibrant identity and its many inhabitants. Captured through the lens of outsiders, the movie celebrates the city's undying spirit despite the current predicament of its existence, while keeping the local indie spirit alive.
snippet: In the latest from the Finnish filmmaker Aki Kaurismaki, two lonely people find each other with tenderness, karaoke and deadpan comedy.
keywords: subject: Movies;persons: Kaurismaki, Aki;creative_works: Fallen Leaves (Movie);

title: Radical
original title: Charlton Heston : la démesure d'un géant
overview: A look at the life and work of the iconic US actor Charlton Heston (1923-2008); the embodiment of many mythic heroes who was both a staunch defender of the Civil Rights movement during the sixties and a spokesman for the National Rifle Association in his later years. The extraordinary and controversial public and personal career of one of the greatest film personalities of all time.
snippet: A vaguely unconventional teacher galvanizes disadvantaged sixth graders in this highly conventional drama.

title: The Creator
original title: Monkey Business: The Adventures of Curious George's Creators
overview: We all know Curious George. But what about his creators, Hans and Margret Rey? From fleeing Nazi Germany on handmade bicycles to encounters with exotic animals in Brazil, the Reys lived lives of adventure that are reflected in the pages on one of the most treasured children’s book series of all time.
snippet: In this hectic, futuristic action film, John David Washington hunts down a threatening artificial intelligence with the baby face of a child.

title: Love at First Sight
overview: After the German reunification: A widowed, unemployed archaeologist with two children and a single futurologist with a little daughter in Berlin fall in love at first sight and persistently and unwaveringly develop a life together. An equally unspectacular and rigorous examination of love as a crucial basis for private and political action.
snippet: Two lovebirds-to-be meet at an airport in this unoriginal but sturdy Y.A. romance, which pivots on the probability of falling in love.

title: Love Life
overview: An octopus slithers into a narrow crack near the shore; we see its eye up close. It feeds on a crab. In spring it's time to mate. A male grabs a female; he inserts his third arm in her respiratory cavity. We watch another pair: a larger female is the aggressor here. Mating is repeated over hours and days. The female releases strings of fertilized eggs that hang from the roof of a nest. She guards her spawn for a month, fanning the strings to circulate water for oxygen and cleanliness.
snippet: In this Japanese drama from Koji Fukada, the death of a child alters life for a couple and for the boy’s previously absent father.
keywords: subject: Movies;persons: Fukada, Koji;creative_works: Love Life (Movie);
